page.title: 19Food.
page.content: The children of Sywell Primary School conducted a survey of peoples eating habits.Most weekdays, people start the day with cereals and toast, and coffee or tea.Lunches tend to be snacks (most children take packed lunches to school) A hot cooked meal is eaten at night when the family is together. At weekends, breakfast tends to be the traditional egg and bacon meal and the main meal of the day is eaten at midday. In the evening, bread, butter and jam, or beans on toast and cake is usual.Eating in restaurants is popular. The children of Sywell are fortunate because they can have hot dinners at midday. They cost 60p. A typical week's menu:sausage,beans,mash,apple pie, custard; fish,chips,biscuits,milkshake; roast pork,potatoes,cabbage,stuffing, jelly; salad,jacket potatoes,jam tart; cheese pie,mash,tomato,chocolate cake.
